title: 113_s1427
content: The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2013" clarifies rules for discharge of governmental claims in Chapter 12 bankruptcies related to farm asset disposition. The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2013" amends Chapter 12 of title 11, United States Code, to address governmental claims arising from the disposition of property used in a farming operation. These claims are treated as unsecured claims, not entitled to priority, provided for under a plan, and discharged according to section 1228. The "Family Farmer Bankruptcy Clarification Act of 2013" amends Chapter 12 of title 11, United States Code, to address governmental claims arising from the disposition of property used in a farming operation. These claims are treated as unsecured claims, not entitled to priority, provided for under a plan, and discharged according to section 1228. Additionally, governmental units may file a proof of claim for a claim that arises after the petition is filed. The debtor must serve notice of a tax claim on the governmental unit if a tax return is filed after the petition, including details of the petition, court location, claim amount, and supporting documentation. The governmental unit has 180 days to file a proof of claim after receiving notice. If they fail to do so, the debtor or trustee can file a claim consistent with the notice. Any claim filed will be determined and allowed or disallowed as if it had arisen before the petition was filed. Technical and conforming amendments are made to chapter 12 of title 11 of the United States Code. The United States Code is amended to provide for the treatment of any claim by a governmental unit as described in section 1232(a). Amendments are made to chapter 12 of title 11 of the United States Code. In amending chapter 12 of title 11 of the United States Code, a comma is inserted after "all debts provided for by the plan" and after "allowed under section 503 of this title." Additionally, in paragraph (2), "the kind" and following text are replaced with "a kind specified in section 523(a) of this title, except as provided in section 1232(c)." In subsection (c)(2), a clause is added before, "except as provided in section 1232(c)." In amending chapter 12 of title 11 of the United States Code, a clause is added to provide for the payment of a claim described in section 1232(a) that arose after the date on which the petition was filed. The amendments made by this section apply to bankruptcy cases pending on the date of enactment of the Act and those commencing after that date.
